passage.text: Genomic organization and single-nucleotide polymorphism map of desmuslin, a novel intermediate filament protein on chromosome 15q26.3

The absence of mutations in the desmuslin gene did not impact its function. Nevertheless, the single-nucleotide polymorphisms mapped in this study are highly disequilibrated and can be used for disambiguation studies of this region of chromosome 15q26.3.

It is crucial to understand the cellular immune response by considering major histocompatibility complex (MHC) molecules as small peptides with restricted amino acid sequences that can be presented to T cells.

While DHBV RNAseH activity was detectable on a set of neo-Nazi (NH2) heteroduplexes produced by cyclic DNA syntheses within DNHC during viral reverse transcription, it was not possible to detect NSDH through NEDH.
